# **Developer Resources**

Welcome to the OHDSI GIS Working Group developer hub. This section provides comprehensive information for developers contributing to the Gaia toolchain and related GIS infrastructure.

<br>

## **Overview**

The OHDSI GIS Working Group develops and maintains a suite of tools collectively known as the **Gaia toolchain**. These tools enable the integration of geospatial data with OMOP Common Data Model (CDM) for population health research.

<br>

## **Repository Ecosystem**

### **Central Hub**
- **[OHDSI/GIS](https://github.com/OHDSI/GIS)** - This repository serves as the central coordination point
  - Documentation website (https://ohdsi.github.io/GIS/)
  - Use case tracking
  - Project management via [GitHub Projects](https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26)
  - Contributing guidelines

### **Core Packages**

**[gaiaDb](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDb)** ![Status: Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-beta-yellow)
- **Technology**: PostgreSQL/PostGIS
- **Purpose**: Core data repository with geospatial processing capabilities
- **Maintainers**: [See repository](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDb)
- **Key Features**:
  - Geospatial data ingestion, management, and analysis
  - SQL routines and PostGIS functionality
  - OMOP CDM integration
  - LinkML/JSON-LD metadata support
  - Spatial indexing and optimization

**[gaiaCore](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaCore)** ![Status: Development](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-development-orange)
- **Development**: [TuftsCTSI/gaiaCore](https://github.com/TuftsCTSI/gaiaCore)
- **Technology**: Multi-language connector framework
- **Purpose**: Provides access to gaiaDB functionality across multiple languages and paradigms
- **Maintainers**: [See repository](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaCore)
- **Key Features**:
  - RESTful API access via PostgREST
  - Direct database connection support
  - Language-specific client libraries (R, Python, etc.)
  - Orchestrates functions defined in gaiaDB
  - OpenAPI specification for API endpoints

**[gaiaCatalog](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaCatalog)** ![Status: Beta](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-beta-yellow)
- **Technology**: Schema.org compliant metadata
- **Purpose**: Data source discovery and cataloging
- **Maintainers**: [See repository](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaCatalog)
- **Key Features**:
  - Metadata management
  - Federated data source discovery
  - Schema.org compliance
  - Integration with external catalogs

**[gaiaDocker](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDocker)** ![Status: Active](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-active-green)
- **Technology**: Docker Compose orchestration
- **Purpose**: Coordinated deployment and versioned releases of the Gaia toolchain
- **Maintainers**: [See repository](https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDocker)
- **Key Features**:
  - Complete GIS stack containerization
  - Coordinated image builds across all components
  - Version management and releases
  - Profile-based deployment (gaia, degauss)
  - Integration with OHDSI Broadsea ecosystem

### **Vocabulary Resources**

**[TuftsCTSI/CVB](https://github.com/TuftsCTSI/CVB)**
- **Purpose**: OMOP vocabulary extensions for GIS
- **Key Vocabularies**:
  - OMOP GIS Vocabulary
  - OMOP Exposome Vocabulary
  - OMOP SDoH Vocabulary
  - Toxins Vocabulary
- **Location**: Delta files in [CVB/GIS/Ontology](https://github.com/TuftsCTSI/CVB/tree/main/GIS/Ontology)

<br>

## **Architecture Overview**

### **Data Flow**

```
External Geospatial Data → gaiaCatalog (Discovery)
                                ↓
                           gaiaDb (Backend Repository)
                           ├── Data Ingestion
                           ├── SQL Routines & PostGIS Functions
                           ├── OMOP Integration
                           └── Exposure Calculation
                                ↓
                           gaiaCore (Access Layer)
                           ├── RESTful API (PostgREST)
                           └── Language Connectors (R, Python, etc.)
                                ↓
                      OMOP CDM + GIS Extensions
                                ↓
                           HADES Analytics
```

### **Tool Chain Components**

1. **Data Discovery** (gaiaCatalog)
   - Input: External data source metadata
   - Output: Cataloged, discoverable datasets

2. **Backend Engine** (gaiaDb)
   - Input: Raw geospatial datasets, patient locations
   - Processing: SQL routines, PostGIS functions, spatial operations
   - Output: OMOP-compliant external exposure data, standardized spatial tables

3. **Access Layer** (gaiaCore)
   - Input: Requests via API or database connections
   - Processing: Orchestrates gaiaDB functions, provides multi-language access
   - Output: Data and function access through RESTful API or direct database connections

4. **Deployment** (gaiaDocker)
   - Input: Component configurations
   - Processing: Orchestrated container deployment
   - Output: Running Gaia toolchain with versioned releases

5. **Analytics** (HADES integration)
   - Input: OMOP CDM + GIS extensions
   - Output: Evidence generation

<br>

## **Getting Started as a Developer**

### **Prerequisites**
- PostgreSQL/PostGIS (>= 12/3.0) for gaiaDb
- Docker and Docker Compose (recommended for coordinated deployment)
- Git and GitHub account
- OHDSI Teams access ([sign up](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=lAAPoyCRq0q6TOVQkCOy1ZyG6Ud_r2tKuS0HcGnqiQZUQ05MOU9BSzEwOThZVjNQVVFGTDNZRENONiQlQCN0PWcu))
- Programming environment of choice (R, Python, etc.) for using gaiaCore connectors

### **Development Environment Setup**

#### **Option 1: gaiaDocker (Recommended)**
```bash
# Clone gaiaDocker repository
git clone https://github.com/OHDSI/gaiaDocker.git
cd gaiaDocker

# Start the full Gaia stack
docker compose --profile gaia up -d

# Verify services
docker compose ps
```

#### **Option 2: Local Development**
1. Clone the gaiaDb repository and set up PostgreSQL/PostGIS
2. Configure PostgREST for API access
3. Install language-specific connectors (R, Python, etc.)
4. Configure connection parameters

See [Deployment Strategies](developer-deployment.html) for detailed setup instructions.

### **First Contribution**
1. Join the [GIS Working Group on Teams](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=lAAPoyCRq0q6TOVQkCOy1ZyG6Ud_r2tKuS0HcGnqiQZUOVJFUzBFWE1aSVlLN0ozR01MUVQ4T0RGNyQlQCN0PWcu)
2. Attend the weekly Friday meeting (10 AM US Eastern)
3. Review the [Project Board](https://github.com/orgs/OHDSI/projects/26)
4. Pick a task or propose a new one
5. Read [Contributing Guidelines](developer-contributing.html)

<br>

## **Development Workflow**

The GIS Working Group follows an **agile, use-case-driven** development approach:

1. **Use Case Identification** - Real-world research needs drive development
2. **Task Breakdown** - Use cases decomposed into GitHub issues
3. **Sprint Planning** - Tasks assigned and tracked via GitHub Projects
4. **Weekly Standups** - Friday meetings (2 min max per person):
   - What did you complete last week?
   - What are you working on now?
   - What's blocking you?
   - Discussion points for later
5. **Development** - Feature branches, pull requests, code review
6. **Integration** - Merge to main, deploy, document
